property_tycoon.model

Class Property

  • java.lang.Object
    • property_tycoon.model.Property
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    PropertyPosition

    public abstract class Property
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a property. This class is abstract and cannot be instantiated directly. Subclasses of this class are not publicly exposed and thus cannot be instantiated directly either. The only way to create a Property instance is to use the static create() methods (recommended) or to extend this class (not recommended).
    Version:
    30/04/2018
    Author:
    meme-team

      • addPropertyChangeListener

        public final void addPropertyChangeListener(java.beans.PropertyChangeListener listener)
        Registers the specified property change listener with this Property object.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to register.

      • buy

        public abstract Property buy(Player buyer)
        Simulates the purchase of this property by setting the owner and returning a version of itself that is owner interactable (can be interacted with: upgraded, downgraded, mortgaged, unmortgaged or sold.)
        Parameters:
        buyer - The player to set as the owner of this property.
        Returns:
        An owner interactable version of this property.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this property has no group or already has an owner.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if buyer is null.

      • downgrade

        public abstract int downgrade()
        Downgrades this property by one improvement level.
        Returns:
        the cash to be credited for downgrading this property.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this property is a proxy and is not valid, if this property has no group (meaning it has no level), no owner, is not improvable, is already the minimum improvement level or if downgrading would cause improvement levels in this property's group to differ by more than one.

      • getDescription

        public abstract java.lang.String getDescription()
        Gets the name of this property.
        Returns:
        The name of this property.

      • getGroup

        public abstract Property.Group getGroup()
        Gets the group to which this property belongs.
        Returns:
        The group to which this property belongs, or null if this property has no group.

      • getImprovementCost

        public final int getImprovementCost()
        Gets the cost of upgrading (debit) or downgrading (credit) this property.
        Returns:
        the cost of upgrading or downgrading this property.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if this property is not improvable.

      • getMortgagedPrice

        public final int getMortgagedPrice()
        Gets the mortgaged value of this property.
        Returns:
        the mortgaged value of this property.

      • getRentPrice

        public final int getRentPrice(int diceValue)
        Gets the cost of renting this property at its current improvement level with the specified value shown on the dice.
        Parameters:
        diceValue - The value shown on the dice.
        Returns:
        the cost of renting this property at its current improvement level.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if this property has no group (meaning it has no level).

      • getRentPrice

        public abstract int getRentPrice(PropertyLevel level,
                                 int diceValue)
        Gets the cost of renting this property at the specified improvement level with the specified value shown on the dice.
        Parameters:
        level - the level of interest.
        diceValue - The value shown on the dice.
        Returns:
        the cost of renting this property at the specified improvement level.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if this property has no group (meaning it has no level), if dice value is not positive, or if level is not in the level group for this property.

      • sell

        public abstract int sell()
        Simulates the sale of this property by unsetting the owner.
        Returns:
        the cash to be credited for selling this property.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this property is a proxy and is not valid, if this property has no owner, or is improvable and is not the minimum level.

      • upgrade

        public abstract int upgrade()
        Upgrades this property by one improvement level.
        Returns:
        the cash to be debited for upgrading this property.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this property is a proxy and is not valid, if this property has no group (meaning it has no level), no owner, is not improvable, is already the maximum improvement level or if upgrading would cause improvement levels in this property's group to differ by more than one.

      • setGroup

        protected abstract void setGroup(Property.Group group)
        Sets the group to which this property belongs. This method should only be called by Property$Group. Subclasses should provide an implementation of this method, but should never call it themselves. When group is set, level should also be set to group.getLevels().getMin().
        Parameters:
        group - The group to set.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this property already has a group.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if group is null.

      • getLevel

        public abstract PropertyLevel getLevel()
        Gets the current improvement level of this property.
        Returns:
        The current improvement level of this property, or null if this property has no level (because it has not group).

      • getOwner

        public abstract Player getOwner()
        Gets the player that currently owns this property.
        Returns:
        The player that currently owns this property, or null if this property has no owner.

      • getPrice

        public abstract int getPrice()
        Gets the unmortgaged value of this property.
        Returns:
        the unmortgaged value of this property.

      • isGrouped

        public abstract boolean isGrouped()
        Indicates if this property is a member of a group.
        Returns:
        true if this property is a member of a group; false otherwise.

      • isImprovable

        public final boolean isImprovable()
        Indicates if this property can be upgraded and downgraded. This method only indicates that a property is genrally improvable. If a property is maximum (getLevel().isMax()) or minimum (getLevel().isMin()) level calls to upgrade and downgrade(), respectively, will still fail.
        Returns:
        true if this property can be upgraded and downgraded; false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this property has no group.

      • isMortgaged

        public abstract boolean isMortgaged()
        Indicates if this property is currently mortgaged.
        Returns:
        true if this property is currently mortgaged; false otherwise.

      • isOwned

        public abstract boolean isOwned()
        Indicates if this property is currently owned.
        Returns:
        true if this property is currently owned; false otherwise.

      • isValid

        public abstract boolean isValid()
        Indicates if this property is a valid proxy that can be used access mutator methods of an underlying real property. This method always returns true for real properties. Any attempt to call a mutator method on a proxy property will raise an exception is this method returns false.
        Returns:
        true if this property is a valid proxy; false otherwise.

      • mortgage

        public abstract int mortgage()
        Mortgages this property.
        Returns:
        the cash to be credited for mortgaging this property.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this property a proxy and is not valid, has no owner, is already mortgaged or is improvable and is not the minimum level.

      • removePropertyChangeListener

        public final void removePropertyChangeListener(java.beans.PropertyChangeListener listener)
        Unregisters the specified property change listener with this Property object.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to unregister.

      • unmortgage

        public abstract int unmortgage()
        Unmortgages this property.
        Returns:
        the cash to be debited for unmortgaging this property.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this property a proxy and is not valid, if this property is not mortgaged, or has no owner.

      • getPropertyChangeSupport

        protected final java.beans.PropertyChangeSupport getPropertyChangeSupport()
        Returns the PropertyChangeSupport associated with this Property object that is used to manage Java Bean property change event handlers. Any time the value of a property in this class changes this object should be used to notify observers.
        Returns:
        The PropertyChangeSupport associated with this Property.
